com.SIMRacingApps

Class ConnectorAWTEventDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.SIMRacingApps.ConnectorAWTEventDispatcher

  • public class ConnectorAWTEventDispatcher
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used by a Java AWT application to send data events to registered listeners. It uses a singleton pattern to create and manage the connection to the SIM. The main routine must call createDispatcher() before anything else is done to establish the singleton instance for the specific SIM. Then others may access the dispatcher using the getDispatcher() method to register listeners for the events. Then, the startThread() method must be called to start the thread that sends the events to the listeners.

    For example: 

      //create a connector to the SIM and pass it to the createDispatcher().
  ConnectorAWTEventDispatcher.createDispatcher(
      Connector.createConnector(m_SIM)
  );
          
  //process connector arguments.
  ConnectorAWTEventDispatcher.getDispatcher().getConnector().setPlay(m_play);
          
  //initialize your application, register all the listeners
  m_geardata = new JDataLabel("Car/REFERENCE/Gauge/Gear/ValueCurrent");
  m_geardata.addPropertyChangeListener("data",
      new PropertyChangeListener() {
          public void propertyChange(PropertyChangeEvent evt) {
              Data d = (Data) evt.getNewValue();
              // normally you would do some fancy formatting that the
              // setFormat() method cannot handle.
              m_geardata.setText("[" + d.getString() + "]");
          }
      });
  widgetPanel.add(m_geardata);
          
  //start the dispatcher thread running to place data into the event queue
  ConnectorAWTEventDispatcher.getDispatcher().startThread();

    • Method Detail

      • createDispatcher

        public static ConnectorAWTEventDispatcher createDispatcher(Connector connector)
        A static factory method that creates the dispatcher instance and returns it. This must be called first so the other methods have access to the singleton.
        Parameters:
        connector - The Connector.
        Returns:
        A reference to the dispatcher singleton.

      • getDispatcher

        public static ConnectorAWTEventDispatcher getDispatcher()
        Returns the dispatcher singleton. Can return null if createDispatcher() has not been called.
        Returns:
        A reference to the dispatcher singleton.

      • getConnector

        public Connector getConnector()
        Returns the connector. Can return null if the createDipatcher() method has not been called.
        Returns:
        The Connector.

      • addPropertyChangeListener

        public void addPropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
                               throws ConnectorAWTEventDispatcher.ConnectorAWTEventsException
        Since I cannot listen unless you give me the name, this method throws an exception. I will leave these here for Bean editors that don't recognize the named ones.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to receive the events.
        Throws:
        ConnectorAWTEventDispatcher.ConnectorAWTEventsException - A fatal exception.

      • addPropertyChangeListener

        public void addPropertyChangeListener(java.lang.String name,
                                      java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Registers a listener to receive events for the named SIM value.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the value.
        listener - The listener to receive the events.

      • removePropertyChangeListener

        public void removePropertyChangeListener(java.lang.String name,
                                         java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Removes a listener that was already registered to receive events for the named SIM value.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the value.
        listener - The listener to receive the events.

      • startThread

        public void startThread(Connector.Callback callback)
        Starts the dispatcher thread. This should be called from the main thread after all your listeners are registered, and only once. It starts a background thread and then returns.
        Parameters:
        callback - (Optional) A callback implementation to receive events.

      • startThread

        public void startThread()
